spec.description: Monitoring with Windows Exporter and Custom Scripts
Number of I/Os to the disk split into multiple I/Os
spec.title: IO Splits

spec.legendFormat: Virtual memory that can be committed without having to extend the paging files

spec.description: Installed logical processors
spec.title: CPU Cores

spec.description: Total packets received by interface that were discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol
spec.title: Unknown Packets Received

spec.description: Parking Status represents whether a processor is parked or not
spec.title: Parking Status

spec.description: Disk space used of all logical disks
spec.title: Disk Space Used Basic

spec.legendFormat: Total number of requests responded to by the NTP server.
Total number of requests received by the NTP server.

spec.description: Busy state of all CPU cores together
spec.title: CPU Busy

spec.legendFormat: Absolute time offset between the system clock and the chosen time source, in seconds.
Total roundtrip delay experienced by the NTP client in receiving a response from the server for the most recent request, in seconds.

spec.description: Absolute time offset between the system clock and the chosen time source, in seconds.
spec.title: Time Syncronized Drift

spec.legendFormat: Total adjustment made to the local system clock frequency by W32Time in parts per billion (PPB) units.

spec.description: Total adjustment made to the local system clock frequency by W32Time in parts per billion (PPB) units. 1 PPB adjustment implies the system clock was adjusted at a rate of 1 nanosecond per second (1 ns/s). The smallest possible adjustment can vary and is expected to be in the order of 100's of PPB.
spec.title: Time Adjustment

spec.description: Active number of NTP Time sources being used by the client. This is a count of active, distinct IP addresses of time servers that are responding to this client's requests.
spec.title: Time Misc

spec.legendFormat: Segments received, including those received in error
Segments sent, including those on current connections, but excluding those containing only retransmitted bytes

spec.title: CPU time spent in user and system contexts

spec.description: Total combined calls to Windows NT system service routines by all processes running on the computer
spec.title: System Calls

spec.description: Operating System
Disk idle time (not servicing read/write requests)
spec.title: Idle I/O
Received and serviced deferred procedure calls (DPCs)

spec.description: Total number of received and serviced clock tick interrupts
spec.title: Clock Tick Interrupts

spec.description: Total number of time processor was woken from idle
spec.title: Idle breaks

spec.legendFormat: Resident portion of file system cache - active in physical memory
Non-paged pool - must remain in physical memory

spec.description: The paged/non-paged pool is an area of the system virtual memory that is used for objects that can/cannot be written to disk when they are not being used.
spec.title: Paged/Non-Paged Pool

spec.legendFormat: Calls to allocate space in the non-paged pool
Calls to allocate space in the paged pool

spec.description: Number of calls to allocate space in the paged/non-paged pool, regardless of the amount of space allocated in each call
spec.title: Paged/Non-Paged Pool - Allocation Calls

spec.legendFormat: Overall rate at which faulted pages are handled by the processor
Satisfied by copying the page from elsewhere in physical memory
Page not found in file system cache
Disk page reads - a single read operation reading several pages is still only counted once
Pages read across all page reads - i.e. counting all pages read even if they are read in a single operation
Disk page writes - a single write operation writing several pages is still only counted once
Pages written across all page writes - i.e. counting all pages written even if they are written in a single operation
Total rate of swap page read and writes

spec.description: These values do not include pages that must remain in physical memory and cannot be written to disk
spec.title: Pageable OS system code + device drivers

spec.legendFormat: Available - immediately available for allocation to a process or for system use
Standby - cached data and code that is not actively in use by processes, the system and the system cache
Free + Zero - assigned to the free and zero page lists, does not contain cached data
Modified - cached data and code that is not actively in use; needs to be written out before it will be available for allocation

matcher.options: Modified - cached data and code that is not actively in use; needs to be written out before it will be available for allocation
Free + Zero - assigned to the free and zero page lists, does not contain cached data

spec.legendFormat: Total exceptions dispatched by the system

spec.description: Number of threads in the processor queue. There is a single queue for processor time even on computers with multiple processors.
spec.title: Processor Queue

spec.description: Number of user sessions for which the operating system is storing state information currently
spec.title: User count

spec.description: FQDN
spec.title: Hostname

spec.legendFormat: Segments received, including those received in error
Segments sent, including those on current connections, but excluding those containing only retransmitted bytes
ActiveOpens - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the SYN-SENT state from the CLOSED state
PassiveOpens - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the SYN-RCVD state from the LISTEN state

matcher.options: PassiveOpens - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the SYN-RCVD state from the LISTEN state

spec.description: The average queue length of the requests that were issued to the device
spec.title: Average Queue Size

spec.description: TCP connections have made a direct transition to the CLOSED state from the SYN-SENT state or the SYN-RCVD state, plus the number of times TCP connections have made a direct transition from the SYN-RCVD state to the LISTEN state
spec.title: TCP Connection Failures

spec.description: Percentage of elapsed time during which I/O requests were issued to the device (bandwidth utilization for the device). Device saturation occurs when this value is close to 100% for devices serving requests serially.  But for devices  serving requests in parallel, such as RAID arrays and modern SSDs, this number does not reflect their performance limits.
spec.title: Time Spent Doing I/Os

spec.legendFormat: Process contexts currently loaded or running
Maximum number of process contexts the operating system can support

spec.title: Time spent in low-power idle states

spec.description: Basic network info per interface
spec.title: Network Traffic Basic

spec.description: Total installed physical memory
spec.title: RAM Total

spec.description: Basic CPU info
spec.title: CPU Basic

spec.description: Basic memory usage
spec.title: Memory Basic

spec.legendFormat: ActiveOpens - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the SYN-SENT state from the CLOSED state
PassiveOpens - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the SYN-RCVD state from the LISTEN state

matcher.options: PassiveOpens - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the SYN-RCVD state from the LISTEN state

spec.legendFormat: {{ af}} - TCP connections for which the current state is either ESTABLISHED or CLOSE- WAIT

spec.title: Windows Monitoring
